project.name: WebWorker
project.description: WebWorker: A wrapper for the HTML 5 web worker API.

params.name: opts
params.description:
The options to be passed into the constructor.
If you pass a `String`, the code will first search for an element selector with the worker script. If it does not find the element it will then use it as a URL to the actual worker script.

classitems.description: A jQuery object created from the webworker instance.
The worker URL (if provided)
classitems.name: _workerUrl

classitems.description: The `Blob` URL generated for the worker.
classitems.name: _workerBlobUrl

classitems.description: The worker script contents (cached for further use).
classitems.name: _workerScript

classitems.description: The native browser worker object. This is generated once the worker is loaded.
classitems.name: _nativeWorker

classitems.description: Store the last error generated by the worker instance.
classitems.name: _lastError

classitems.description:
Indicates if the worker script has loaded.
This is set to `true` once the worker script has
successfully loaded after the `.load()` method call.
classitems.name: _hasLoaded

classitems.description:
Since `WebWorker` terminate calls are asynchronous,
this is used to keep track of whether a terminate call
was initialized.
classitems.name: _isTerminateInitialized

classitems.description:
The main constructor calls this method. This method
was moved out of the main constructor to keep the
code clean.
classitems.name: _constructor

params.name: opts
params.description: Arguments to the main constructor

classitems.description: Returns the worker URL if one was provided during object instantiation.
classitems.name: getUrl

classitems.description: Returns the worker blob URL if one has been generated.
classitems.name: getBlobUrl

classitems.description: Returns the native browser worker instance if one has been generated.
classitems.name: getNativeWorker

classitems.description: Returns whether the worker script has been loaded.
classitems.name: hasLoaded

return.description: Returns `true` if the worker script has loaded, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description: Triggers the instance to load the worker script and generate a native browser worker.
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: Generates the native browser worker and attaches the message parser to it.
classitems.name: _createWorker

classitems.description: Assigns the basic internal event handlers to the worker instance.
classitems.name: _assignEventHandlers

classitems.description: Returns whether a worker terminate was initialized.
classitems.name: isTerminateInitialized

return.description: Returns `true` if a terminate has been initialized, `false` otherwise.

classitems.description:
Start the worker (if it has loaded). Any arguments passed to this method will be passed internally to the worker script.
Note that you should start the worker only AFTER it has loaded. If you call this method before the worker has loaded it will fail silently.
classitems.name: start

params.name: args
params.description:
Arguments to be passed internally to the worker script.
Please ensure that arguments are basic objects that can be cloned by the browser for `postMessage` interface.

classitems.description:
This method acts as the main communications interface with the worker and is used internally.

**You are recommended to use the trigger interface _ONLY_ as it is the most reliable mode of communication between the instance and the actual worker.**

If you do understand the risks, you are welcome to use this method (a reason why it is left public instead of private).

It's basic usage is very simple. Specify the `action`, which is the method name to call _inside_ the worker script, and the arguments to pass in. The worker does the rest of the heavy lifting.

Note: This method is NOT synchronous and will not warn you of any errors.
classitems.name: sendMessage

params.name: action
params.description: The name of the method within the worker script to call.

params.name: args
params.description:
The array of arguments to pass to the worker. Ensure that this data
                    can be cloned by the browser for the `postMessage` interface.

classitems.description:
Attaches the message parser to the native worker. This allows the worker to hook into
`postMessage` API and set up a communications protocol between the instance and the
native browser worker.
classitems.name: _attachMessageParser

classitems.description:
This method triggers the worker to terminate. Terminating is ASYNCHRONOUS. This method
sets the ball rolling. It sends the message to the worker which may have a
`terminateHandler` that can do some cleanup operations before control is passed back
to the instance and the final terminate (`terminateNow`) is executed.
classitems.name: terminate

classitems.description:
Terminates the worker _immediately_.
This method can be used to terminate the worker _immediately_, instead of waiting for the asynchronous terminate cycle to complete.
It is also called internally once the asynchronous `terminate` cycle passes control back to the instance to execute the final terminate.
classitems.name: terminateNow

params.name: returnValue
params.description:
This value is passed to with the data on the
                             WORKER_TERMINATED event. It is also used internally to
                             pass the return value of the `terminateHandler` from
                             the worker in the asynchronous terminate cycle.

classitems.description: Used to bind event listeners to the worker. Internally it uses the jQuery `.on` method.
classitems.name: on

params.name: args
params.description: Lookup the jQuery `.on` API for argument list.

classitems.description: Used to bind event listeners to the worker for single execution. Internally it uses the jQuery `.one` method.
classitems.name: one

params.name: args
params.description: Lookup the jQuery `.one` API for argument list.

classitems.description: Used to unbind event listeners from the worker. Internally it uses the jQuery `.off` method.
classitems.name: off

params.name: args
params.description: Lookup the jQuery `.off` API for argument list.

classitems.description:
Used to trigger events on the worker. Internally it uses a combination of the jQuery `.trigger` method and a custom trigger for triggering events on the native worker script.

If an event type is recognized as an internal event type, the trigger is executed on the base instance using jQuery. Otherwise the `.sendMessage` API is used to pass the trigger to the worker script.
classitems.name: trigger

params.name: event
params.description:
This can be a string `eventType` or an object `event`. Please ensure that if using
                      object events, that they are clonable by the browser for the `postMessage` API.

classitems.description:
You may want to trigger an event on the base worker instance irrespective of it's event type. Use this
method to achieve the same.
classitems.name: triggerSelf

params.name: event
params.description: This can be a string `eventType` or an object `event`.

classitems.description: Internal method to trigger events on the base worker instance.
classitems.name: _triggerSelf

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to `trigger`.

classitems.description:
Throw error on the worker instance. This internally triggers the `error` event. Optionally you can also make this method throw an exception.
This method also internally updates the `lastError` value on the instance and static properties.
classitems.name: throwError

params.name: error
params.description: Error string that describes the error.

params.name: data
params.description: Data that is to be associated with the error event.

params.name: throwException
params.description: Set to `true` if you want to throw an exception in addition to the error event.

classitems.description: Internal method used to trigger the `error` event on the instance.
classitems.name: _triggerError

params.name: error
params.description: Error string that describes the error.

params.name: data
params.description: Data that is to be associated with the error event.

params.name: throwException
params.description: Set to `true` if you want to throw an exception in addition to the error event.

classitems.description: Returns the last error that was trigger on this worker instance.
classitems.name: getLastError

return.description: The last error message that was thrown on this worker instance.

classitems.description: The last error encountered across all WebWorker instances.
classitems.name: _lastError

classitems.description:
List of pre-defined actions for the WebWorker instance.

     "START"                 : 'start'
     "SET_TERMINATING_STATUS": 'setTerminatingStatus'
     "TERMINATE"             : 'terminate'
     "TERMINATE_NOW"         : 'terminateNow'
     "TRIGGER"               : 'trigger'
     "TRIGGER_SELF"          : 'triggerSelf'
classitems.name: Action

classitems.description:
List of pre-defined events for the WebWorker instance.

     "INITIALIZED"       : 'webworker:initialized'
     "ERROR"             : 'webworker:error'
     "WORKER_LOADING"    : 'webworker:worker-loading'
     "WORKER_LOADED"     : 'webworker:worker-loaded'
     "WORKER_STARTING"   : 'webworker:worker-starting'
     "WORKER_STARTED"    : 'webworker:worker-started'
     "WORKER_TERMINATING": 'webworker:worker-terminating'
     "WORKER_TERMINATED" : 'webworker:worker-terminated'
classitems.name: Event

classitems.description: Reverse mapping of pre-defined events for faster lookup.
classitems.name: EventMap

classitems.description:
Pre-defined list of errors for the WebWorker instance.

     "UNKNOWN"            : "An unknown error occured."
     "INVALID_ARGUMENTS"  : "Invalid arguments were supplied to this method."
     "WORKER_DID_NOT_LOAD": "Unable to load worker."
classitems.name: Error

classitems.description: Retrieves the last error thrown by any WebWorker instance.
classitems.name: getLastError

return.description: The last error string thrown by any WebWorker instance.

classitems.description:
A jQuery-like method to assign the WebWorker class under a different context and className.
You may either provide the context and class name as params
OR use the return value to set it
OR both.
classitems.name: noConflict

params.name: context
params.description: The context to which the WebWorker instance needs to be associated.

params.name: className
params.description: The class name with which the WebWorker instance will be identified.

return.description: The last error string thrown by any WebWorker instance.
